title: News
description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.

items.title: A rare but dangerous flesh-eating bacteria is infecting Florida residents
items.content_html: Hurricane Ian caused storm surges of up to 12 feet, leaving behind warm, brackish floodwaters where Vibrio vulnificus thrives.
items.summary: Hurricane Ian caused storm surges of up to 12 feet, leaving behind warm, brackish floodwaters where Vibrio vulnificus thrives.

items.title: Putin orders martial law in occupied Ukrainian areas as Kyiv's forces gain ground
items.content_html: The move signals Russia's growing frustration over Ukrainian advances in areas the Kremlin claimed to annex. It came hours after Kremlin-appointed officials ordered civilians to evacuate Kherson.
items.summary: The move signals Russia's growing frustration over Ukrainian advances in areas the Kremlin claimed to annex. It came hours after Kremlin-appointed officials ordered civilians to evacuate Kherson.

items.title: The IRS is increasing the standard deductions for 2023 as inflation intensifies
items.content_html: The IRS is increasing energy-related tax breaks, as well as standard deductions for single and married people and heads of households.
items.summary: The IRS is increasing energy-related tax breaks, as well as standard deductions for single and married people and heads of households.

items.title: Nestlé recalls its stuffed chocolate chip cookie dough
items.content_html: The voluntary recall is for Nestlé Toll House Stuffed Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough with Fudge Filling products manufactured between June and September. Some consumers found plastic pieces in them.
items.summary: The voluntary recall is for Nestlé Toll House Stuffed Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough with Fudge Filling products manufactured between June and September. Some consumers found plastic pieces in them.

items.title: Does Marjorie Taylor Greene represent the future of the Republican Party?
items.content_html: Journalist Robert Draper says the GOP's embrace of extremism opened the door to fringe actors, who've become among the party's most influential leaders. His new book is Weapons of Mass Delusion.
items.summary: Journalist Robert Draper says the GOP's embrace of extremism opened the door to fringe actors, who've become among the party's most influential leaders. His new book is Weapons of Mass Delusion.

items.title: Herschel Walker plans to hand out fake police badges to highlight support for police
items.content_html: After being called out for flashing an honorary police badge at a debate, Herschel Walker's campaign is embracing the moment with plans to distribute 1,000 fake badges as a fundraising prop tomorrow.
items.summary: After being called out for flashing an honorary police badge at a debate, Herschel Walker's campaign is embracing the moment with plans to distribute 1,000 fake badges as a fundraising prop tomorrow.

items.title: Ukrainians keep a wary eye on U.S. midterm elections, fearing a loss of support
items.content_html: The likelihood that Republicans may win the House has triggered concerns in Ukraine. Last month, most House Republicans voted against a funding package that included billions earmarked for Ukraine.
items.summary: The likelihood that Republicans may win the House has triggered concerns in Ukraine. Last month, most House Republicans voted against a funding package that included billions earmarked for Ukraine.

items.title: Enrollment in Korean classes has shot up. Thank K-pop
items.content_html: College student enrollment in language classes has plateaued in recent years, but enrollment in Korean language classes rose 78% from 2009 to 2016.
items.summary: College student enrollment in language classes has plateaued in recent years, but enrollment in Korean language classes rose 78% from 2009 to 2016.

items.title: Online platforms radicalized the Buffalo mass shooting suspect, a new report says
items.content_html: The New York attorney general's office said it reviewed thousands of pages of documents and social media content to study how the suspect used online platforms to plan and publicize the mass shooting.
items.summary: The New York attorney general's office said it reviewed thousands of pages of documents and social media content to study how the suspect used online platforms to plan and publicize the mass shooting.

items.title: Val Demings goes on attack against Marco Rubio in Florida Senate debate
items.content_html: Democratic U.S. Rep. Val Demings of Florida went on the attack Tuesday in her first debate against Republican Sen. Marco Rubio.
items.summary: Democratic U.S. Rep. Val Demings of Florida went on the attack Tuesday in her first debate against Republican Sen. Marco Rubio.

items.title: The family of George Floyd plans to file a $250 million lawsuit against Ye
items.content_html: The announcement of the lawsuit comes after Ye, the rapper formerly known as Kanye West, made comments about Floyd's death on the podcast Drink Champs.
items.summary: The announcement of the lawsuit comes after Ye, the rapper formerly known as Kanye West, made comments about Floyd's death on the podcast Drink Champs.

items.title: The family of slain Palestinian American journalist Shireen Abu Akleh demands justice
items.content_html: It's been over five months since Abu Akleh was killed on the job, most likely by Israeli forces. Her niece tells Morning Edition about her aunt's legacy and her family's campaign for accountability.
items.summary: It's been over five months since Abu Akleh was killed on the job, most likely by Israeli forces. Her niece tells Morning Edition about her aunt's legacy and her family's campaign for accountability.

items.title: A New Jersey teacher accused of pulling a student's hijab sues an Olympic fencer
items.content_html: A girl reported to her mother in October 2021 that her teacher had yanked her hijab from her head while at school. The teacher says the Olympian's social media post ruined her reputation and career.
items.summary: A girl reported to her mother in October 2021 that her teacher had yanked her hijab from her head while at school. The teacher says the Olympian's social media post ruined her reputation and career.

items.title: Hair straightening chemicals may increase women's risk of uterine cancer, study finds
items.content_html: The findings are a concern for Black women, researchers say, who are far more likely to report using straightening products such as relaxers.
items.summary: The findings are a concern for Black women, researchers say, who are far more likely to report using straightening products such as relaxers.

items.title: The U.S. creates a legal pathway for Venezuelan migrants, but many won't qualify
items.content_html: The Biden administration has announced a new legal pathway to discourage Venezuelan migrants from crossing the border illegally. But many may not qualify because they lack financial sponsors.
items.summary: The Biden administration has announced a new legal pathway to discourage Venezuelan migrants from crossing the border illegally. But many may not qualify because they lack financial sponsors.

items.title: 3 reasons why China may become more assertive — and what that means for the U.S.
items.content_html: Xi Jinping is expected to break longstanding tradition in the coming days and secure a third term as China's president. It will mark a new era for China and likely lead to more tensions with the U.S.
items.summary: Xi Jinping is expected to break longstanding tradition in the coming days and secure a third term as China's president. It will mark a new era for China and likely lead to more tensions with the U.S.

items.title: Without more federal money, what will regional theaters do?
items.content_html: Subscriptions and ticket sales are down, but theater is needed more than ever. What theaters are doing to survive.
items.summary: Subscriptions and ticket sales are down, but theater is needed more than ever. What theaters are doing to survive.

items.title: Paying for mental health care leaves families in debt and isolated
items.content_html: A youth mental health crisis and a shortage of therapists and other care providers who take insurance are pushing many U.S. families into financial ruin. But it's rarely acknowledged as medical debt.
items.summary: A youth mental health crisis and a shortage of therapists and other care providers who take insurance are pushing many U.S. families into financial ruin. But it's rarely acknowledged as medical debt.

items.title: Athlete Elnaz Rekabi, who competed without a hijab, returns to Iran
items.content_html: Competitive climber Elnaz Rekabi received a hero's welcome on her return to Tehran Wednesday, after competing in South Korea without wearing a mandatory headscarf required of Iranian female athletes
items.summary: Competitive climber Elnaz Rekabi received a hero's welcome on her return to Tehran Wednesday, after competing in South Korea without wearing a mandatory headscarf required of Iranian female athletes

items.title: Biden administration plans to release 15 million barrels from U.S. oil reserves
items.content_html: President Biden is set to announce Wednesday that the U.S. plans to draw 15 million barrels of oil out of its strategic stockpiles in December.
items.summary: President Biden is set to announce Wednesday that the U.S. plans to draw 15 million barrels of oil out of its strategic stockpiles in December.

items.title: Pandemic-related fraud totaled billions. California is trying to get some of it back
items.content_html: A special task force is investigating claims and freezing accounts to determine who legitimately qualifies for the relief money. About $20 billion in unemployment money was stolen by criminals.
items.summary: A special task force is investigating claims and freezing accounts to determine who legitimately qualifies for the relief money. About $20 billion in unemployment money was stolen by criminals.

items.title: Biden releasing 15 million more barrels from the strategic oil reserve to tame prices
items.content_html: The Department of Energy has another 400 million barrels in its strategic reserves, which the White House plans to restock as soon as prices fall to $67 to $72 per barrel.
items.summary: The Department of Energy has another 400 million barrels in its strategic reserves, which the White House plans to restock as soon as prices fall to $67 to $72 per barrel.

items.title: A jury convicted Paul Flores of murdering college student Kristin Smart in 1996
items.content_html: Kristin Smart, a college freshman, vanished from a California campus in 1996. Paul Flores was the last person seen with Smart as he walked her home from an off-campus party.
items.summary: Kristin Smart, a college freshman, vanished from a California campus in 1996. Paul Flores was the last person seen with Smart as he walked her home from an off-campus party.
